problem_text:
The spectrum of a finite group is the set of orders of its elements. Does there exist a finite group G whose spectrum coincides with the spectrum of a finite simple exceptional group L of Lie type, but G is not isomorphic to L?
A. V. Vasil’ev
answer: Yes, for example, for L = 3D4(2) (V. D. Mazurov, Algebra Logic, 52, no. 5 (2013), 400–403). Further examples are given in M. A. Grechkoseeva, M. A. Zvezdina, J. Algebra Appl., 15, no. 9 (2016), Article ID 1650168, 13 pp.).
